page.title: 06Primary School Collingham
page.content: {John Blow Primary School}was built in 1963 to cater for children from the ages of 5 to 11.There are 7 classrooms,a large assembly hall,kitchens and extensive playing fields.180 children attend full time,enjoying the facilities of a modern,well equipped school. The aims of the school are to provide an{evenly balanced curriculum}which is constructed in such a way as to encourage each child to learn and grow according to his or her needs.Also to {develop socially }caring for each other and the surroundings in which we live.Because of this,{environmental {work }is at the centre of the curriculum.During the past two years { {computer learning}has been introduced. The future will see more emphasis being placed on technology and it is for us to prepare children for this.
